$interpreted: Impatient Clan Villager: He's still not here yet? It was him who chose this remote and distant town. That southerner better not be up to any funny business, or I'll—
???: ...Keep your cool. The coldest snow is also the quietest, remember?
Impatient Clan Villager: Y-yes, I'm much too agitated. Forgive me, Clan Mother!
Valdrir: ...Good.
Valdrir: Hold tight. We'll leave at once if we see anything suspicious.
Cautious Clan Villager: Okay... But, Clan Mother...
Valdrir: What is it?
Cautious Clan Villager: Your fingernail's bleeding... You've hurt yourself.
Valdrir: (Ah! I scratched a little too hard in all my anxiousness...)
Cautious Clan Villager: You were hiding your dealings with that southerner from the Grand Sorcerer, so it's no wonder you were feeling nervous. And we—
Valdrir: (She's going to rattle the tribe's faith in me! What should I do...)
Valdrir: ...Nonsense. The aurora tells of all fates—and as one of the chosen Twins, I'm simply following my destiny. What is there to be nervous about?
Cautious Clan Villager: But it's plain as daylight, the Grand Sorcerer doesn't wish to offer any sacrifice...
Valdrir: It is forbidden to second guess the Grand Sorcerer's intentions. Are you looking to be punished?
Cautious Clan Villager: No...! We're only worried that once the sacrifice is made, you'll...
Valdrir: ...I know how serious this is. This meeting is simply for the record.
Valdrir: As long as the Grand Sorcerer presides at Lysfete, and reads the trajectory of the aurora for us so that we can cleanse Vendacti of its curse, we needn't—
???: I wouldn't take a position before the negotiations have even begun, if I were you.
???: We meet at last, Valdrir Asfjord, Clan Mother of the Saga. I am Theodore Carlos, of the Kingdom of the Sun.
Theodore: I trust you've been informed of the rest well ahead of time.
Valdrir: (This is the man who drove Eidatyr away...)
Valdrir: ...And behind you, that must be... Rune?
Theodore: I'm not surprised you have trouble recognizing him. After all, brother and sister have been separated since childhood.
Theodore: Tell her who you are, Rune.
Rune: Rune. Valdrir's brother, is Rune.
Valdrir: Wait, he looks... different from how I'd heard...!
Theodore: I agreed to deliver him to you. That's all that matters.
Impatient Clan Villager: Watch your mouth, Southerner! You're in northern territory now, so don't try anything stupid!
Theodore: Hmph, we're in the north, all right. But wherever one is, courtesy is a basic requirement.
Theodore: —Show them, Rune.
Valdrir: (...Such power, and those runes... That's my twin, all right... Who'd have thought that this would be how we were reunited...)
Valdrir: The outcome is clear. They've learned their lesson, so stop now.
Valdrir: I said stop. On this land, those who do not abide by the Saga clan mother's rulings will be punished.
Valdrir: Do you want to be punished?
Valdrir: ...Make him stop, Theodore!
Theodore: Isn't this how you northerners do things up here? This way you can see for yourself whether his runes are genuine or not.
Valdrir: Enough! I believe you! Stop it now!
Theodore: You can stop, Rune.
Rune: Yes, Master.
Impatient Clan Villager: What the hell... Nearly killed me... That lad's not to be messed with...
Valdrir: What have you done to him?
Theodore: We have potions in the Kingdom of the Sun that can make our political opponents a little more reasonable.
Theodore: Rune wanted to see his family, and I agreed to help him. In return, he's protecting me. I'm just ensuring that we both get what we want.
Theodore: ...After all, the last time I negotiated with a northerner, they plotted to kill me and kidnap Rune.
Theodore: For now, he listens only to my commands, so the sooner our business is over with, the better it'll be for you, too.
Valdrir: You...! That's my twin brother!
Theodore: I thought it was an offering you were after? When did a twin brother enter the picture?
Valdrir: ...Guh...
Theodore: We've wasted too much time already. Or did you come here just to quibble over details?
Valdrir: ...Tell us what your terms are. You want us to send troops to help you steal back the throne?
Theodore: Stealing back the throne... Now there's an idea...

Model.Text: He's still not here yet? It was him who chose this remote and distant town. That southerner better not be up to any funny business, or I'll—
...Keep your cool. The coldest snow is also the quietest, remember?
Y-yes, I'm much too agitated. Forgive me, Clan Mother!
...Good.
Hold tight. We'll leave at once if we see anything suspicious.
Okay... But, Clan Mother...
What is it?
Your fingernail's bleeding... You've hurt yourself.
(Ah! I scratched a little too hard in all my anxiousness...)
You were hiding your dealings with that southerner from the Grand Sorcerer, so it's no wonder you were feeling nervous. And we—
(She's going to rattle the tribe's faith in me! What should I do...)
...Nonsense. The aurora tells of all fates—and as one of the chosen Twins, I'm simply following my destiny. What is there to be nervous about?
But it's plain as daylight, the Grand Sorcerer doesn't wish to offer any sacrifice...
It is forbidden to second guess the Grand Sorcerer's intentions. Are you looking to be punished?
No...! We're only worried that once the sacrifice is made, you'll...
...I know how serious this is. This meeting is simply for the record.
As long as the Grand Sorcerer presides at Lysfete, and reads the trajectory of the aurora for us so that we can cleanse Vendacti of its curse, we needn't—
I wouldn't take a position before the negotiations have even begun, if I were you.
We meet at last, Valdrir Asfjord, Clan Mother of the Saga. I am Theodore Carlos, of the Kingdom of the Sun.
I trust you've been informed of the rest well ahead of time.
(This is the man who drove Eidatyr away...)
...And behind you, that must be... Rune?
I'm not surprised you have trouble recognizing him. After all, brother and sister have been separated since childhood.
Tell her who you are, Rune.
Rune. Valdrir's brother, is Rune.
Wait, he looks... different from how I'd heard...!
I agreed to deliver him to you. That's all that matters.
Watch your mouth, Southerner! You're in northern territory now, so don't try anything stupid!
Hmph, we're in the north, all right. But wherever one is, courtesy is a basic requirement.
—Show them, Rune.
(...Such power, and those runes... That's my twin, all right... Who'd have thought that this would be how we were reunited...)
The outcome is clear. They've learned their lesson, so stop now.
I said stop. On this land, those who do not abide by the Saga clan mother's rulings will be punished.
Do you want to be punished?
...Make him stop, Theodore!
Isn't this how you northerners do things up here? This way you can see for yourself whether his runes are genuine or not.
Enough! I believe you! Stop it now!
You can stop, Rune.
Yes, Master.
What the hell... Nearly killed me... That lad's not to be messed with...
What have you done to him?
We have potions in the Kingdom of the Sun that can make our political opponents a little more reasonable.
Rune wanted to see his family, and I agreed to help him. In return, he's protecting me. I'm just ensuring that we both get what we want.
...After all, the last time I negotiated with a northerner, they plotted to kill me and kidnap Rune.
For now, he listens only to my commands, so the sooner our business is over with, the better it'll be for you, too.
You...! That's my twin brother!
I thought it was an offering you were after? When did a twin brother enter the picture?
We've wasted too much time already. Or did you come here just to quibble over details?
...Tell us what your terms are. You want us to send troops to help you steal back the throne?
Stealing back the throne... Now there's an idea...
